prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Normalize counts, make two PCA plots for samples, one color coded samples by "group" and the other color coded by "LibrarySelection" in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
	diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
I apologize for the errors. My previous assumptions might not have been correct. It seems the row names for `colData_df` are NULL. So it is important to ensure that the column order in `colData_df` matches that of `cnts_m`. Also, you might need to set rownames for `colData_df` using `row.names` function.

```
# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(DESeq2)
library(readxl)
library(tidverse)

# Read in the count data
cnts <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Convert the count data to matrix and set rownames
cnts_m <- as.matrix(cnts[, -1])
rownames(cnts_m) <- cnts$Genes

# Read in the sample data
colData <- read_tsv("SRP021193.colData.tsv", col_types = cols())

# Arrange the columns of count data according to order in colData
cnts_m <- cnts_m[, colData$diagnosis]

# Convert to DataFrame and set rownames
colData_df <- DataFrame(colData)
row.names(colData_df) <- colData_df$diagnosis

# Create the DESeq2 object
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(
  countData = cnts_m,
  colData = colData_df,
  design = ~ group  # adjust the design as per your experiment
)

# Perform normalization
dds <- DESeq(dds)

# Rlog transformation
rld <- rlog(dds, blind = FALSE)

# PCA plot colored by 'group'
df <- plotPCA(rld, intgroup="group", returnData=TRUE)
percentVar <- round(100 * attr(df, "percentVar"))
ggplot(df, aes(PC1, PC2, color=group)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  xlab(paste0("PC1: ",percentVar[1],"% variance")) +
  ylab(paste0("PC2: ",percentVar[2],"% variance")) +
  coord_fixed()

# PCA plot colored by 'LibrarySelection'
df <- plotPCA(rld, intgroup="LibrarySelection", returnData=TRUE)
percentVar <- round(100 * attr(df, "percentVar"))
ggplot(df, aes(PC1, PC2, color=LibrarySelection)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  xlab(paste0("PC1: ",percentVar[1],"% variance")) +
  ylab(paste0("PC2: ",percentVar[2],"% variance")) +
  coord_fixed()
```
